questions.question: What was the main aim of social and religious reform movements in India?
questions.answer: Social equality and reform

questions.question: Who founded the Brahmo Samaj?
questions.answer: Raja Ram Mohan Roy

questions.question: Which reformer worked for the abolition of Sati?
questions.answer: Raja Ram Mohan Roy

questions.question: Who founded the Arya Samaj?
questions.answer: Swami Dayanand Saraswati

questions.question: Which movement emphasized return to the Vedas?
questions.answer: Arya Samaj

questions.question: Who worked for widow remarriage?
questions.answer: Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar

questions.question: Who founded the Ramakrishna Mission?
questions.answer: Swami Vivekananda

questions.question: Which reformer worked for women's education?
questions.answer: Savitribai Phule

questions.question: The Prarthana Samaj was active mainly in which region?
questions.answer: Maharashtra

questions.question: What was an important result of reform movements?
questions.answer: Social awakening

questions.question: What was an important result of reform movements?
questions.answer: Social awakening

questions.question: What were social and religious reform movements?
questions.answer: They were movements aimed at removing social evils and reforming religious practices.

questions.question: Who was Raja Ram Mohan Roy?
questions.answer: He was a social reformer who worked for abolition of Sati and founded the Brahmo Samaj.

questions.question: What was the aim of Arya Samaj?
questions.answer: To remove social evils and promote Vedic values.

questions.question: What work did Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar do?
questions.answer: He worked for widow remarriage and women's education.

questions.question: Why were reform movements important?
questions.answer: They created social awareness and encouraged equality and education.

questions.answer: They were movements aimed at removing social evils and reforming religious practices.
